Text.Value: Just a merchant. At least look at what's on offer before you embarrass yourself.
Show me your wares.
Alas, you cannot eat grandmother's ashes, nor can you easily trade a golden candelabra for a bowl of soup. That is where I come in - liquidity. Their heirlooms, for my gold.
*A curious philosophy. Better suited to a follower of the Shar then some common racketeer.*
Dangerous places, camps like these. According to Baldur's Mouth, you never know who might be a cut-throat.

EditorData.NodeContext: Slippery smile. 'Yeah I killed him, but good luck proving it'

Text.Value: Of course I am. Dead bodies are bad for business - as are people asking the wrong sort of question.
Difficult to get a good day's trade done when I'm expected to keep watch for Shadowheart at the same time. Who knows when she'll finally turn up?
Your point being?
Me? I lighten their load.
It is a most welcome absence, in my estimation.
You help them? How?
Why, I am aiding them. They gain both the gold they need, and lose the material desires weighing them down.
A tragedy, really - but we must not judge. Perhaps I could show you some of my special goods to take your mind off this ugliness?
Is that so? What a remarkable coincidence... or perhaps not.
That's it? You're just a merchant?
*The phrase 'welcome absence' catches in your mind - it is the refrain of a popular Sharran hymn.*
So you buy their heirlooms and valuables at a low rate? Genius - I applaud you.
Indeed.
Sounds like you've got wares for sale. Mind if I take a look?
*While it's an odd philosophy for a racketeer - the sentiment would fit a follower of the Nightbringer perfectly.*
How charitable of you.
These are desperate people - who is to say what lengths some of them may have gone to, just to earn the money to survive?
Leave.
If you're looking for companionship, I hear they can cater to almost every taste in Sharess' Caress. I'm not on offer, unfortunately.
I'd tell you more, but they value discretion above all. As do I.
This gemstone you sell bought seems to be a perfect fit for a ring I found on a dead body...
I took you for one of them for a moment. The refugees, that is.
Charity is a luxury. Fickle, occasional gestures from guilty hearts. I run a business.
You're a recent arrival for sure, still bearing dust from the road... but you have something they lack. Dignity.
You're a little too eager to brush off that dead body.
These wretches have nowhere to call home, nothing to live off but what they carry, and nobody to help them but themselves... and me, of course.
There is an enterprise within the city that I help to support. I know I said I wasn't given to charity, but this place is dear to my heart.
Welcome. You see to peruse the special goods, I take it?
Well in that case, I can only assume whoever stole it then gave it to me willingly.
Trade secrets. But I can guarantee you that nothing I have to offer was stolen - it was all given happily and willingly. Every last item.

EditorData.NodeContext: Amused by a private joke. His claim is technically true

Text.Value: And what do you do with all these goods you're acquiring?
There wares are too exotic to have been purchased from refugees, surely. Who's your supplier?
It isn't just about gold for you, is it? There's more this that you're letting on...
A carrion bird would have more dignity. This city feeds on those that need it most.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bitter. Seeing evidence of the unfortunate being taken advantage of.

Text.Value: A pity more don't share your open mind. I always say it's just business, but some don't see it that way.
My, your imagination runs hot, doesn't it? Perhaps you should turn to poetry, or offer your services to Baldur's Mouth. I hear those rag traders enjoy a bit of fiction.
That sounds... lucrative?
Hear hear. Though I'd keep your speech low, friend - not many share our outlook on the matter.
You're taking advantage of the desperate.
Now. would you like to see what I have to offer, or would you like to leave? I'll be quite content, either way.
Is that so? Well perhaps you should retrieve her then.
A slippery fellow. Perhaps his thoughts will reveal what his lips won't.
A tithe must always be paid - no matter how harsh. Such is life.
You mentioned you had wares to trade?
Perhaps you are cannier than I first gave credit to be. I have some very special wares reserved for exclusive clientele... but I think you've earned a peek.
Sure, show me what you have.
Long enough to value discretion.
That's despicable conduct - you should aid the needy, not exploit them.
Back again? It is nice to converse with someone who isn't circling the drain, like this lot. Looking on their maudlin faces does sap my spirits...

EditorData.NodeContext: Referring the refugees present in the general area around him

Text.Value: Fool. Think anyone will miss you if you vanish in a place like this? Let's find out...

EditorData.NodeContext: Aggressive (player was caught trying to read his mind) combat ensues after

Text.Value: What about that ring? Seems that was stolen.
An exchange of objects, nothing more. We all lose everything in the end.
You'd be shocked by the sort of things they bring with them. Gold and jewels they can't easily exchange. Heirlooms, rarities, sentimental items - even cremation urns...
You're like a dog with a bone, aren't you?
So, how long have you worshipped Shar?
I have an acquaintance you might be more willing to deal with. Her name is Shadowheart.
Leave.
This gemstone I bought seems to be a perfect fit for a ring I found on a dead body...
Even carrion birds would not stoop so low.

Synopsis: Ferg is a Sharran lookout instructed to watch out for Shadowheart but also works as a fence and money launderer for the Sharran cult. Players can convince him to offer his unique and unusual wares for trade.
